author: The Globe and Mail - Jason Kirby
title: Move over boomers, Gen X is rolling in it | Flipboard
text: Move over boomers, Gen X is rolling in it Gen X, the forgotten generation derided as slackers by its predecessors, has mostly avoided being drawn into the often nasty generational feud between millennials and baby boomers over wealth, privilege and opportunity. That could get tougher once everyone realizes just how well off Gen Xers have … [The Globe and Mail](/@globeandmail) flipped this story into [Business](/@globeandmail/business-hsh2uqeaz)•3h Related storyboards More stories from [Human Geography](/topic/humangeography) [America is uniquely ill-suited to handle a falling population](/topic/humangeography/america-is-uniquely-ill-suited-to-handle-a-falling-population/a-WSfgbi41SSKbcaLLNH85Kw%3Aa%3A37374060-f29a4e72d8%2Feconomist.com) Cairo, a town at the southern tip of Illinois founded in the early 19th century, was given that name because it was expected to grow into a huge … The United States has enjoyed some level of population growth virtually every year for more than a century. But that doesn't mean every state is always growing in lockstep. See which American states are losing population and learn the possible reasons as to why. But that doesn't mean every state is … [Ruins on remote Pacific island are ‘much older’ than once thought, study reveals](/topic/humangeography/ruins-on-remote-pacific-island-are-much-older-than-once-thought-study-reveals/a-IdLpTC6nQ0qRCVo8Acbgyg%3Aa%3A2867092696-25564cf268%2Fbnd.com) The Tongan island of Tongatapu — located about 1,400 miles northeast of New Zealand — is covered with clusters of man-made mounds long believed to … Join the flipboard community Discover, collect, and share stories for all your interests [Sign up](/signup) More stories from [Geography](/topic/geography) [NY Times Reverses Stance: Biden NOT Losing Latino Voters](/topic/geography/ny-times-reverses-stance-biden-not-losing-latino-voters/a-LokCFZraRmaa2uH8SME8PQ%3Aa%3A484531373-4a2e700b7b%2Fcrooksandliars.com) That day when The New York Times destroys its own spin that Biden's losing Latino voters. A newly released New York Times/Siena poll shows a wholesale … [Northern Lights shine over Iceland’s erupting volcano in stunning timelapse footage](/topic/geography/northern-lights-shine-over-iceland-s-erupting-volcano-in-stunning-timelapse-foot/a-Cs00iIi0RcSrW5c60MAg2g%3Aa%3A2867092696-2e4479c6ed%2Fflipboard.com) A stunning timelapse video shows the Northern Lights shining over an erupting volcano in southwestern Iceland. The current eruption, now ongoing for 28 days, became officially the second longest of the seven that have occurred in the last three years, after the six-month-long 2021 Fagradalsfjall eruption. It occurred near the fishing town of Grindavik, about 30 miles southwest of Reykjavik, Iceland’s capital, sending lava towards the community that is home to 3,800 people. Just one crater is erupting at the moment and the active lava flow is confined close to the volcanic cone, far from any infrastructure.
